title: 81x26: 18 U.S.C. § 207(a), Rulemaking, and Representations to the Government
summary: 18 U.S.C. § 207(a) did not prohibit a former Government attorney from preparing a client memo analyzing rules which he had been personally and substantially involved in creating as a Federal employee.  Section 207 applies to representations before and communications to the U.S., and rulemaking is not a "particular matter involving a specific party."
